Amsterdam

Your Guide To The Best New Year’s Eve Parties in Europe

New Year’s Eve can be a tricky time of year to navigate with thousands of parties springing up in cities all over the world.

 November 18, 2016 

Where to Stay in Amsterdam: The ultimate Amsterdam hostel bucket list

Where to stay in Amsterdam? Whether you are in the Dutch capital to explore the city like a cycling god, or to sample the city’s unbeatable music scene at ADE Festival next week, y

 November 1, 2016 

Hostelworld Sessions – Live Music With Sunset Sons

Imagine going from washing dishes in a bar, to touring the world as a professional rocker! Well that’s exactly what happened to the British-Australian indie band Sunset Sons.

 October 21, 2016 

Unmissable Amsterdam in 48 hours

For some, Amsterdam may conjure up an image of rowdy stags, the Red Light District and stoned tourists but this city’s quirky culture goes way deeper.

 April 13, 2016 

Hostel of the Week: Lucky Lake Hostel, Amsterdam

If you are looking for a trip to Amsterdam with a kitsch twist and a yellow bus to eat breakfast in every day, Lucky Lake Hostel is for you.

 April 7, 2016 

15 things to do for free in Amsterdam

Here at Hostelworld, we are clued up on what travelers from all over the world spend their money on whilst visiting Amsterdam and contrary to popular belief, it isn’t museums.

 December 1, 2015 

Hostelworld visits CLINK NOORD Hostel in Amsterdam

Last week we flew to Amsterdam for the opening bash of the latest addition to the Clink hostel family.

 September 25, 2015 

Hostel of the Week Stayokay Vondelpark, Amsterdam

A monumental chalet building overlooking the largest city park in Amsterdam, you’d be forgiven in thinking you’ve just stepped onto a 1930’s movie set.

 August 26, 2015 

Hostel of the Week Flying Pig Downtown, Amsterdam

If you’re looking for a hostel with the true Amsterdam spirit, then head downtown to the Flying Pig.

 August 19, 2015 

15 of the Best Places for Coffee in Amsterdam

Amsterdam is world-famous for its “coffee shops” that offer more than just a cup of coffee, but in recent years there’s been an explosion of amazing places to get high on goo

 April 22, 2015

About the Blog
Our aim with this travel blog is to feed and water your wanderlust. Here we share our best travel tips with the help of our favourite travel writers; such as where to find those authentic, soul-filled places, and the hottest hostels to stay in while you’re at it. We’ll give you a sneak peek into hostel life, solo travel and the friend filled adventures you can have on the road! Read on if you’re ready to be inspired to #MeetTheWorld BEYOND the tourist brochure!
